info.description: API contains operations on Broker Desk resource.
info.title: Broker Desk

post.description:
Create one or more broker desks to a maximum of 100 per request.
Required fields:- brokerTicker,deskType. 
Users needs to have permissions under permType='brkrDskCon' for using this API.

post.description:
Filters broker desks based on a single broker ticker(for basic filtering) or any combination of the following filters : 
List of broker tickers, broker type and broker entity (for advance filtering).

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

enumsActionType.description:
Represents type of validation being performed.

 - ACTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value.
 - ACTION_TYPE_CREATE: Validation for create request.
 - ACTION_TYPE_UPDATE: Validation for update request.

enumsFilterType.description:
Represents type of filter being performed.

 - FILTER_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value.
 - FILTER_TYPE_BASIC: Option for Basic filter- Filters Data on the basis of a single ticker and/or loadDefunct flag.
 - FILTER_TYPE_ADVANCE: Option for Advance filter - Filters data on the basis of advanced filters like list of tickers, BrokerType, entity , etc.
 - FILTER_TYPE_ID: Option for filter on list of id's- Filters data on the basis of list of id's.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

requests.description:
A maximum of 100 broker desks can be created in a batch.
Broker Id , desk type are mandatory fields in all create request.
Broker Desk Id, Broker Entity should not be part of any create request.
requests.title: Create Broker Desks request

skipBqlValidation.title:
Skip BQL Validation flag - to skip the bql validation for the request.
(-- api-linter: core::0233::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this flag is common to all request objects which determines whether to skip bql validation or not --)

v1BatchRemoveBrokerDesksRequest.title:
The request message for BrokerDeskAPI.BatchRemoveBrokerDesks.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-parent-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we have a oneof parent instead --)

brokerId.title:
Aladdin Broker Identifier (Numeric) (Not supported currently).
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this refers to the id of the broker which is part of the oneof parent --)

brokerTicker.title:
Broker ticker.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this refers to the id of the broker which is part of the oneof parent --)

requests.description: A maximum of 100 broker desks can be deleted in a batch.
requests.title: Remove Broker Desk request

requests.description:
A maximum of 100 broker desks can be updated in a batch.
Broker Entity should not be specified at this stage in any update request.
requests.title: Update Broker Desks request

skipBqlValidation.title:
Skip BQL Validation flag - to skip the bql validation for the request.
(-- api-linter: core::0234::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this flag is common to all request objects which determines whether to skip bql validation or not --)

brokerId.title:
Aladdin Broker Identifier (Numeric) (Not supported currently).
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this refers to the id of the broker which is part of the oneof parent --)

brokerTicker.title:
Broker ticker.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this refers to the broker ticker which is part of the oneof parent --)

requests.description: A maximum of 100 broker desks can be validated in a batch.
requests.title: Validate Broker Desks Request

actionType.description: Enum that determines whether the request is a create request or an update request, to perform validation accordingly.
actionType.title: ActionType enum

skipBqlValidation.title:
Skip BQL Validation flag - to skip the bql validation for the request.
(-- api-linter: core::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this flag is common to all request objects which determines whether to skip bql validation or not --)

status.description: The status of the operation in case of failure/success.

brokerDeskValidation.description: Represents the validation associated with the broker desk records.

v1BrokerDesk.description:
Each broker in Aladdin will have at least one desk assigned.
The desk selected for a trade designates the group and specific contact at the broker firm with whom the transaction was done.

id.description:
Resources must have a 'id' field.
Name describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
Desk id.

brokerId.description: Represents Aladdin Broker Identifier (Numeric), commonly referred to as broker code.

brokerEntity.description: Broker entity based on the decode BROKER_ENTITY.

deskRule.description: Represents rule like BQL to default a Desk to a Trade.

v1BrokerDeskExtendedQuery.description: The query required to perform a filter query.

brokerTickers.description: Broker ticker for which broker desk data is to be retrieved.

v1BrokerDeskQuery.description: The query required to perform a filter query.

loadDefunct.description: Load Defunct Flag - If true , will load all (including defuncts) , else will only load non defunct data.

brokerDeskExtendedQuery.description: Broker Desk Extended Query containing additional filters on desk data.

filterType.description: Enum to determine the type of filter being performed - Basic/ Advanced.

v1CreateBrokerDeskRequest.title:
The request message for BrokerDeskAPI.CreateBrokerDesk.
(-- api-linter: core::0133::request-parent-required=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is a top-level
 resource --)

brokerDeskQuery.description: Query used to filter broker desks, such as broker ticker.
brokerDeskQuery.title: Filter Broker Desks Query

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of BrokerDesks to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified i.e 0, then complete list of
BrokerDesks will be returned.

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterBrokerDesks' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterBrokerDesks' must match the call that provided the page
token.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

id.description: id of the broker desk to be un deleted.

v1UpdateBrokerDeskRequest.title:
The request message for BrokerDeskAPI.UpdateBrokerDesk.
(-- api-linter: core::0134::request-mask-required=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: Update masks are not being used --)

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.investment_operations.reference_data.bro: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.reference_data.broker.v1.BrokerDesk API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.investment_operations.reference_data.bro: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.reference_data.broker.v1.BrokerDesk API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
